lindelt.either

Class Eithers

  • java.lang.Object
    • lindelt.either.Eithers

  • public final class Eithers
extends Object
    Utility class providing methods for working with Either objects, primarily for the purposes of partitioning and sorting collections of Either objects.
    Since:
    0.8

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Eithers.Partition<L,R>
      Class holding directionally-partitioned values from a collection of Either objects.

    • Method Detail

      • comparator

        public static <L extends Comparable<? super L>,R extends Comparable<? super R>> Comparator<Either<? extends L,? extends R>> comparator(boolean reverseContents,
                                                                                                                                       boolean reverseDirection)
        Creates a Comparator imposing a total ordering on Either objects containing Comparable types. When both boolean parameters are false, the returned Comparator imposes a natural ordering upon Either objects such that Left-holding Either objects are always less than right-holding Either objects, and Either objects with the same directionality are ordered based upon the natural ordering of their held values. The Comparator will throw a NullPointerException if it attempts to compare a null value.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Upper bound for the left type of the Either objects to be compared.
        R - Upper bound for the right type of the Either objects to be compared.
        Parameters:
        reverseContents - Reverses the ordering of the values within a direction if true.
        reverseDirection - Reverses the ordering of the directions if true.
        Returns:
        A Comparator for ordering Either objects.
        See Also:
        nullableComparator(boolean, boolean)

      • nullableComparator

        public static <L extends Comparable<? super L>,R extends Comparable<? super R>> Comparator<Either<? extends L,? extends R>> nullableComparator(boolean reverseContents,
                                                                                                                                               boolean reverseDirection)
        Creates a Comparator imposing a total ordering on Either objects containing Comparable types. Behaves identically to comparator(boolean, boolean) with the exception that null is treated as a third direction that is less than concrete instances under natural ordering.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Upper bound for the left type of the Either objects to be compared.
        R - Upper bound for the right type of the Either objects to be compared.
        Parameters:
        reverseContents - Reverses the ordering of the values within a direction if true.
        reverseDirection - Reverses the ordering of the directions if true.
        Returns:
        A Comparator for ordering nullable Either objects.

      • partition

        public static <L,R> Eithers.Partition<L,R> partition(Collection<? extends Either<? extends L,? extends R>> eithers)
                                              throws NullPointerException
        Partitions a collection of Either objects based upon directionality, returning an empty partition if the provided collection is null.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Left type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        R - Right type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        Parameters:
        eithers - Collection of Either objects to be partitioned.
        Returns:
        A Partition object containing the result of partitioning the collection of Either objects into its left and right values, or an empty partition if
        Throws:
        NullPointerException

      • partitionInto

        public static <L,R> void partitionInto(Collection<? extends Either<? extends L,? extends R>> eithers,
                                       Eithers.Partition<? super L,? super R> partition)
                                throws NullPointerException
        Partitions a collection of Either objects into the provided Partition based upon directionality. Does nothing if the provided collection of Either objects is null.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Left type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        R - Right type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        Parameters:
        eithers - Collection of Either objects to be partitioned.
        partition - Partition object to partition the left and right values into.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If eithers is not null and partition is null.

      • partitionInto

        public static <L,R> int partitionInto(Collection<? extends Either<? extends L,? extends R>> eithers,
                                      Collection<? super L> lefts,
                                      Collection<? super R> rights)
                               throws NullPointerException,
                                      UnsupportedOperationException,
                                      IllegalArgumentException,
                                      IllegalStateException
        Partitions a collection of Either objects into the provided collections based upon directionality and returns the number of null values encountered. Does nothing if the provided collection of Either objects is null. May leave the left or right value collections in an invalid state if the Collection.add(Object) operation throws on any of the values held by the collection of Either objects.
        Type Parameters:
        L - Left type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        R - Right type of the Either objects to be partitioned.
        Parameters:
        eithers - Collection of Either objects to be partitioned.
        lefts - Collection to partition the left values into.
        rights - Collection to partition the right values into.
        Returns:
        The number of null values in eithers, or 0 if eithers is null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If eithers is not null and lefts or rights are null.
        UnsupportedOperationException - If either lefts or rights does not support the Collection.add(Object) operation.
        IllegalArgumentException - If some property of a value held by eithers prevents it from being added to the appropriate collection.
        IllegalStateException - If a value held by eithers cannot be added to the appropriate collection due to insertion restrictions.
